FixICE.org

Many people want to respond to ICE, deportations, and related policies—but they don't know what website to use. This website was created to make it easier to find resources. If you want to talk to someone or figure out where to start, contact Fix ICE and we will trade phone numbers.

This site curates actions into a few clear categories, so you can choose what fits your energy, time, and comfort level:

  • Protest – show up in person
  • Advocate – make calls, send postcards, take quick actions
  • Volunteer – support organizations doing sustained work
  • Donate – fund effective efforts
  • Boycott – apply economic pressure

Each section is intentionally limited to one page, with links to trusted groups and concrete actions.

Weekly Standouts at Burlington ICE Detention Center

This group organizes Monday and Tuesday protests 11–1 against the ICE detention center in Burlington. Other groups organize Wed–Sat protests. See the dedicated page for details. Each group brings a different approachespresence, art, and public witnessing—that strengthen the movement.

Want more guided and detailed “how do I start?” information?

If you’re looking for step-by-step guidance on how to get involved or start something new, we highly recommend: Choose Democracy website.

It’s an excellent resource for understanding how individual actions add up—and how to begin.

Why this site exists

FixICE.org was created by someone who felt overwhelmed by the volume of information and wanted a calmer way to help others take action.

You don’t need to do everything.
You just need a place to start.
